Description:
21 Tech is looking for a Business Data Analyst to work at our client's site in Chicago, IL. This is a 3 months contract position. You must be authorized to work in the United States without sponsorship, No H1B.

Day-to-day operations include analysis of weather data (past and forecast), in relation to various sectors, including agriculture (corn, soybeans, wheat) and energy (power and gas). Expertise in any of the following fields/markets would be highly beneficial: Meteorology, Atmospheric sciences, Climatology, Agriculture, Crop Production, Natural Gas, Power production, to name a few. 

The short-term role will be based in our client´s office in downtown Chicago. The analyst will be expected to interpret results using a variety of techniques, work with colleagues to understand impacts on crops and energy markets, talk with clients on occasion, and write reports to be published to applications within one of our client´s products.. Requires a bachelor's degree in area of specialty and 4-6 years of experience in the field or in a related area, if possible. A wide degree of creativity and latitude is expected. Will report directly to Head of Weather Research, also located in Chicago office.

Job Description - Enterprise Database Administrator - SQL Server (255715)Job Description Enterprise Database Administrator - SQL Server-255715Description Works under the supervision of the Manager of the Enterprise Database Team, the Enterprise Database Administrator is responsible for the deployment and continued support of mission critical SQL Server and mySQL database systems.  Using technologies such as SQL Server Management Console, SQL Server Query Analyzer, SQL Server Profiler, SQL Server Always-On, SQL Server Log-Shipping, and the management required for the support of mySQL database systems, the position is responsible for the availability, stability, and performance of the database systems at Adventist IT.
 
The position also requires demonstrated competence in administration of BI Analytic tools such as SQL Server Integration Services (SSRS), SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS), SQL Server Analysis Services (SSAS), and an understanding in the newly released PowerBI tools.   
 
The Enterprise Database Administrator is responsible for the coordination of cross-functional teams when related to the deployment and support of the physical/virtual database servers.  This includes technologies such as: VMWare, Red Hat Linux, Oracle Linux, Windows Server, physical servers, and the supporting storage teams.
Last, the Enterprise Database Administrator ensures all data is handled in accordance with established policies, procedures, and specifications.  Maintains the database environment to meet or exceed compliancy with established standards, policies and configuration guidelines.  The position also participates in an on-call rotation for the support of the database systems during and outside business hours.
 
 Qualifications 
Job Requirements

Minimum of 5 years of demonstrated skills in the installation, configuration, and continued support of the SQL Server database platform in a highly virtualized environment.  This also includes the in-depth knowledge of performance tuning of SQL Server database systems, the implementation of high-availability features such as Always-On, Log-Shipping and Replication.
Minimum of 3 years of demonstrated skills in the support of business analytic applications such as SSIS, SSRS, and SSAS.  Initial experience in learning PowerBI is helpful as well.
Exposure to the support of mySQL Systems is preferred but not required.
Strong verbal and written communication skills are required.
Excellent customer service is a must.Job: Information TechnologyOrganization: Adventist ITPrimary Location: US-FL-Altamonte SpringsSchedule: Full-timeShift: DayJob Level: Staff / AssociateEducation Level: Bachelor's DegreeTravel: NoJob Posting: Oct 2, 2017, 12:17:48 PM

Job Description - Analyst Business Intelligence Investments (257233)Job Description Analyst Business Intelligence Investments-257233Description If you want to be a part of a place that provides nothing less than extraordinary compassionate care, then Adventist Health System is the place for you!
 
We are currently seeking qualified candidates for an Analyst Business Intelligence Investments position that will be based in our Investments department. This position is based at our corporate office in Altamonte Springs, FL.  
 
This position provides the opportunity to be mainly responsible for the creation of BI solution reports, visualizations, charts and interactive dashboards. This position will solicit requirements from business project sponsors and lead projects from planning through implementation. Will define needs and recommend solutions that deliver value to stakeholders and build analytics for operational use and other business solutions. Ability to work effectively within the investment team, accounting/finance partners, and other technical and business teams. Continually maintain working knowledge of the current toolsets and future toolsets used by the investment team.
 
Specific job duties include: 

Design and implement business intelligence (BI) reporting, dashboards and analytics for the Investment department
Develop database views, SQL queries, stored procedures to support reporting/analytics and interactive dashboards
Determines a project’s requirements by extracting them from business project sponsors, as well as from current and future users, through interaction and research
Coordinates with other developers on the team to build and share knowledge, ensuring consistent delivery of information
Create static reporting using Microsoft SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS) and dynamic dashboard using Microsoft Power Business Intelligence (PowerBI) 
Defines project requirements by identifying project milestones, phases, and elements
Support, maintain and develop new and existing business intelligence solutions
Create technical documentation for data/reporting processes
 
Experience Requirements:

3+ years of experience in development, testing and implementation of reports and dashboards (SSRS, PowerBI, QlikView or any BI report & dashboard tool) required
 
Educational Requirements:

Minimum Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Database Systems, Software Engineering, Management Information Systems, Business Administration or similar major required
Certified Business Analysis Professional (CBAP) preferred 
 
Knowledge and Skills Required: 

Ability to develop code to support tabular/matrixed reports and dashboards with multiple grouping, summations, aggregations and calculations
Proficient at scripting in structured query language (SQL, T-SQL or PL/SQL)
Skilled in writing database views, stored procedures and functions to develop business intelligence solutions
Familiarity with relational database design
Knowledge of building, deploying, testing and maintaining reports or dashboards
Exceptional interpersonal skills and a team player
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Ability to solicit business requirements and implement as BI solutions
Desire to learn and work with new technologies 
 

If this position sounds like a great match for your skills set and experience, please apply online now!

advanced statistical solutions for our clients

 

This position requires an
individual with a combination of computational and analytical skills. The

PythonMachine Learningexperience with machine learning algorithms, such as

Job Description - Data Developer 2 / ETL (0089524)Job Description Data Developer 2 / ETL - (0089524) The Developer II (Data Analysis) works with the Lead Developer to design and develop technical solutions on a proprietary, multi-node computing environment focused on 'big data' processing (billions of records).   
 
This requires full SDLC familiarity, including requirements review, analysis, design, programming, testing and implementation as assigned.
 
Responsibilities

Verify input data quality, including identification and communication of file variances and potential issues
Read data file dumps and QC conversion output.
Set up, process and QC data hygiene and merge/purge processes
Set up and process statistical reports and provide these reports to account teams.
Maintain and adhere to project schedules.
Qualifications


Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field or equivalent years of experience required
1-3 years of development experience required 
Proven analysis, design, programming and implementation experience is required 
Experience manipulating and joining multiple, large data files (Millions of records, 100’s of GB) required.
Knowledge of data formats – character fields, packed fields, binary, hexadecimal fields required.
Experience with flat files, Ascii/Ebcdic, binary data, bitmapping, and ETL processing fundamental.  
Knowledge and understanding of HADOOP, cloud computing, massively parallel-processing systems strongly preferred.
Knowledge of UNIX environment/directory structures /Linux/DO environment is helpful
Experience with data compression algorithms and techniques preferred.
Development experience with C, C++, Perl, Shell Scripting preferred
Experience with database programs and basic SQL Knowledge and preferred
Familiarity with Agile Development concepts, JIRA, and GIT
Ability to solve problems without using traditional tools, software, or relational databases.
Knowledge of data hygiene, address standardization, etc is a plus.
Strong written and oral communications skills
Ability to read, create, and change existing code
Ability to coordinate and follow up with multiple tasks
Attention to detail necessary
Ability to recommend and implement automation solutions for production process.

Job Description - Data Analyst II (00001LO4)Job Description Data Analyst II - 00001LO4 Description POSITION SUMMARY:



 

Under
broad direction, the Data Analyst II participates in and leads a
variety of analytic and robotic process automation (RPA) projects and
activities within the Global Financial Shared Services team. They will provide
support to internal customers in developing analytic solutions, measuring
business performance, identifying revenue opportunities/leakage and improving
efficiencies. Additionally, the Analyst - Data Analyst II will work with
subject matter experts to assess automation opportunities and then develop and
implement the RPA solution. They must have a good understanding of data access
requirements for business analytics and exploration. Also required is the
ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with team
members, as well as an innate curiosity around wanting to understand business
processes, business strategy and strategic business initiatives to help drive
incremental business value from enterprise data assets.

 



PRIMARY
DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:



Works with other team members and business stakeholders
to drive development of business analytics requirements.Leverages enterprise standard tools and platforms to
visualize analytics insightsManage RPA life cycle
     (discovery, documentation, design, development, testing, implementation,
     maintenance) Performs knowledge transfer around using data
visualization and RPA tools to business stakeholders.Manage process assessment workshops to understand
     the requirements of 
     processes (White board , Process study & Brainstorm sessions) Recommends and implements enhancements to
     methodologies and procedures to improve reporting and analysis  Participates in and/or leads our
     RPA efforts within the Global Financial Shared ServicesPerforms related duties as assigned.
 Qualifications EXPERIENCE AND
EDUCATIONAL REQUIREMENTS:



Requires some training in fields such as business
administration, accountancy, sales, marketing, computer sciences or similar
vocations generally obtained through completion of a four year Bachelor's
Degree program, technical vocational training, or equivalent combination of
experience and education. Normally requires a minimum of three (3) to five (5)
years directly related and progressively responsible experience; experience in
application programming is an asset.

MINIMUM
SKILLS, KNOWLEDGE AND ABILITY REQUIREMENTS:



Experience
     with data visualization/BI tools, such as Qlik or Tableau, SQL and
     semantic data access mechanisms.Experience in driving analytics-enabled business
process innovation.Working knowledge of  SQLAbility to quickly visualize complex implementation plans
     with multiple stakeholders and cross-domain dependencies to determine
     critical paths. Solid understanding of programming conceptsAbility to communicate effectively both orally and in
     writingAbility to prioritize work load and consistently meet
     deadlinesStrong organizational skills; attention to detailGood analytical and problem solving skills to evaluate
     business problems and apply applications knowledge to identify appropriate
     solutions Good interpersonal skills; effective team player
 Organization: Finance Job: Information Technology Jobs Schedule: Full-time Primary Location: United States-Texas-Frisco Equal Opportunity Employer/Minority/Female/Disability/Veteran

Job Description - Data Analyst I (00001LPB)Job Description Data Analyst I - 00001LPB Description 
Individuals within the Data Management role work closely with customers,
vendors, business analysts and application development project teams to resolve
information flow and content issues. They ensure data integrity and compliance
by performing data cleansing and data validations. They provide data that is
congruent, synchronized, and reliable and information that is readily
accessible by the user. They analyze and develop logical data models and
relational data definitions in support of corporate and customer information
systems requirements. When data related system problems occur, they also
perform root-cause analysis and recommend or execute corrective action.

Data Management professionals understand the methodologies and
technologies that depict the flow of data within and between technology systems
and business functions/operations. Additional responsibilities include the
identification and resolution of information flow, content issues and the
transformation of business requirements into logical data models. They identify
opportunities to reduce data redundancy, trends in data uses and single sources
of data.

 

WORK COMPLEXITY:


 Works on one or more
     projects/issues/enhancements as a team member.
 Works on small to medium,
     moderately complex projects.
 Designs logical data models of low
     to medium complexity.


PRIMARY DUTIES AND
RESPONSIBILITIES:




 
  
  Strategic Planning
  
  
  
  
   Provides input in support of the
       strategic planning process and short and long term planning.
  
  
  
 
 
  
  Governance and
  Standards
  
  
  
  
   Assists in the development of data
       standards, policies and procedures.
   Works with IT teams to ensure
       compliance.
   Works with IT teams to ensure
       compliance.
   Acts as a gatekeeper for new data
       that do not meet the set business requirements.
  
  
  
 
 
  
  Business
  Requirements
  
  
  
  
   Works with the IT teams to
       understand data requirements.
   Stays informed of the ways the
       organization uses its data.
   Gathers and documents the data
       needs of a project.
  
  
  
 
 
  
  Data Management
  
  
  
  
   Populates and references data
       dictionary during any development activity.
   Collects, analyzes and summarizes
       data to support business decisions.
   Ensures that the information is
       named properly and defined consistently across the organization.
   Provides data that is congruent and
       reliable and is easily accessible by the user.
   Identifies opportunities for reuse
       of data across the enterprise.
   Validates data sources.
   Assists with management of all
       metadata associated with individual models.
   Manages the flow of information
       between departments.
  
  
  
 
 
  
  Data Modeling
  
  
  
  
   Translates business requirements
       into conceptual, logical and physical data model.
   Develops and maintains the logical
       and physical data models.
   Works with database administrator
       to create physical database designs.
   Collaborates with team members to
       review data models, and reporting structures for better data management
       and quicker access.
   Assists in creating a framework for
       representing the data elements including the entities, relationships and
       attributes.
   May recognize and resolve conflicts
       between models, ensuring that data models are consistent with the enterprise
       model (i.e., entity names, relationships and definitions).
   Works closely with other IT groups
       to use the data models throughout the whole life cycle.
  
  
  
 
 
  
  Data Quality
  
  
  
  
   Utilizes tools to monitor and mass
       update data changes.
   Executes data profiling and
       preventative procedures to improve data quality.
   Monitors and resolves daily
       exception reports.
   Uses technology to extract and
       analyze raw data.
   Escalates problems as needed.
   Participates in projects that
       require data quality testing and produces metrics and samples for
       further analysis.
   Identifies opportunities and
       supports the development of automated solutions that will enhance the
       quality of enterprise data.

	Apply
                             Company The Boeing Company
         Job ID 1700016164          Date posted 10/10/2017   
   
           Location
            Seattle

            Other Locations 
            North Charleston;South Carolina;United States~Saint Louis;Missouri;United States~
                 
      
        Job Description
         
Are you ready to join one of the most successful companies in the world and help them achieve their quest of becoming a leader in the area of data analytics? The Boeing Company is looking for a data scientist to support our Analytics & Information Management Services organization. The organizational scope supports Boeing enterprise-wide programs and functions, and data scientists will have opportunities to work on projects which have the highest priority to the business. Paramount to success in this role is the ability to determine, define and deploy predictive/prescriptive analytic solutions to identify and perform root cause analysis on adverse trends, by choosing best fit methods, defining algorithms, and validating and deploying models to achieve results. Here is a breakdown of some specific responsibilities this data scientist will take on: - Interface directly with senior data scientists to support development of advanced analytics solutions supporting key Boeing functions: Commercial and Government Aftermarket Services; Engineering, Manufacturing, Quality, Safety, Supply Chain, HR, Finance, and Corporate. - Modify and analyze data sets using complex analytics techniques such as machine learning, advanced statistical analysis, mathematical optimization and simulation. - Identify modeling attributes and parameters. - Apply algorithms to create descriptive, predictive or prescriptive models to achieve analysis. - Investigating challenging data characteristics, complexity, quality, and meaning. - Through visualizations and summarizations, define performance, identify trends, outliers and drivers. - Participate in determination of stakeholders needs and ensures business value is realized. - Communicate, advise, and collaborate with business partners. - Support development team to deliver production solutions (e.g. visualizations, reports, algorithms, models, dashboards, tools). Why Work for Boeing? We take care of our people. Boeing invests more than $23 Billion a year in employees in the form of pay, incentives, benefits and wellbeing programs. At Boeing, Total Compensation is more than a paycheck. It’s a market-leading combination of pay, incentives, benefits and well-being programs that can help you through all aspects of life. This includes: Competitive Base Salary with potential for yearly performance adjustments Industry leading health care options 401K with company match (Ranked #2 in the country by Bloomberg) Yearly performance bonus Lots of PTO! This includes vacation, sick leave, holidays, and a company-wide winter break. Tuition reimbursement Company discount program. (Get discounts on everything from Apple to Zipcar) We provide opportunities to work on groundbreaking projects and technology. From commercial airplanes and military fighter jets to satellites and space exploration, Boeing’s knowledge of design and manufacturing of all things in the air is unmatched—by anyone. You will be part of an organization that is working to solve the world’s most difficult aerospace problems. We innovate. We imagine the impossible and make it a reality through our integrated One Boeing approach. Our teams in Data Science, Engineering, Human Resources, Procurement, Marketing & Sales, and so many more, work in tandem to give insight that becomes actionable intelligence to improve customer experiences, bring warfighters home safely, and deliver desired outcomes. We deliver, every day. And have for more than 100 years. Whether through on-time arrivals or completed missions, Boeing delivers outcomes and insights that are making the world a place with limitless possibilities. 
Boeing is the world's largest aerospace company and leading manufacturer of commercial airplanes and defense, space and security systems. We are engineers and technicians. Skilled scientists and thinkers. Bold innovators and dreamers. Join us, and you can build something better for yourself, for our customers and for the world. 
            
            
            Division
            CIO, Information & Analytics
                
         
            Relocation Assistance Available 
            Yes. Available for eligible candidates, if authorized.
         
 
            Qualifications 
            This position requires an active (or ability to obtain) U.S. Security Clearance, for which the US Government requires US Citizenship. 
Required Skills and Experience
- Experience developing data science solutions using machine learning methodologies and tools (e.g. Linear Regression, Logistic Regression, Decision Trees, Random Forests, Support Vector Machines, Neural Networks, Deep Learning (Tensorflow)) - Experience working with cross functional teams and business partners defining data requirements and incorporating analytics into their processes including through visualizations, user interfaces, and operational improvements. - Object oriented programming experience (e.g. R, Python, Java, etc.) - Experience working with big data analytics databases and interpreting data (e.g. SQL, Teradata, Hadoop, Hive, Spark, Hbase, NoSQL, graph DB’s) - Technical bachelor's degree and typically 2 or more years' related work experience or a Master's degree. A technical degree is defined as any four year degree, or greater, in a mathematic, scientific or information technology field of study.

Job Description - LPN II (DC Schools) - CSS (170000D9)Job Description LPN II (DC Schools) - CSS - (170000D9)Description The Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) is responsible for implementing the School Health Services program under the direction and supervision of a registered nurse. The LPN will provide comprehensive nursing services to individuals, families and communities in the areas of health promotion and disease prevention while safeguarding their integrity and recognizing their right to make their own decisions. Interpret student immunization needs. Continue to expand clinical base of nursing knowledge and skills. Daily work activities may include screenings (i.e. vision, hearing, BMI) , evaluation and treatment of conditions, and referrals. Assists the registered nurse in determining the needs of the general student population and children with special health care needs.  Qualifications Minimum Education Requirements
High School Diploma or GED

Minimum Experience Requirements
3 years

Specific Requirements and Preferences
At least 3 years of supervised nursing experience in community health or child health prior to entry into school nursing practice. Experience in the care of school-aged children.

Required Licensees and/or Certifications
Must possess a valid unencumbered license to practice as a Licensed Practical Nursing in the District of Columbia. Must maintain current certification in cardio-pulmonary resuscitation and first aid from a recognized provider.

Required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities
Knowledge and understanding of a school health program, including recognizing trends relating to school health as well as developmental patterns and needs of school-age children. Knowledge of the techniques of data collection for an analysis of health needs. Knowledge of a wide variety of medical conditions, diagnoses, and specific diseases. Knowledge of medications and medication administration practices. Ability to provide general health information to school age children and families with a wide variety of health problems under the supervision of a registered nurse.

Functional Accountabilities Customer Focus

Work's at school(s) assigned by manager.
Place a high priority on serving customers.
Oriented to the school health services program, the schools within their area, and the requirements of elementary, middle and high school.
Participate in school health educational activities, committees or projects.
Utilize verbal and non-verbal communication with school age child/families and all members of the healthcare team.
Collaborate with multidisciplinary team in the school setting.
Works closely with the RN to provide follow-up until student needs are met.
Nursing Process

Manage acute, complex, chronic and communicable health problems, such as reporting communicable diseases, sexually transmitted diseases, asthma, neurological conditions, hypertension and diabetes in, school setting.
Contribute to individualized plan of care and execute plan utilizing resources as needed.
Provide documentation based on school health/hospital standards.
Identify ongoing education of school age child/families based on plan of care.
Evaluate school age child/family response to education and document progress towards goals.
Quality Improvement Initiatives

Participate in quality improvement activities.
Identify performance improvement opportunities.
Leadership Skills 

Develop organizational and prioritization skills necessary to complete assignments within acceptable timeframe, i.e., screenings, mandatory health education, etc.
Support management decisions and contribute to a positive work environment.
Take responsibility for learning policies and standards.
Identify own learning needs and seek opportunities to meet those needs.
Forward Thinking/ Promoting Change
Demonstrate flexibility and willingness to change.
Contribute to a positive work environment.
Identify and resolve issues, overcoming challenges.
Identify new patterns and trends and anticipates impact.
Teamwork/ Communication

Partner with all team members to achieve goal.
Work effectively with diverse groups.
Communicate effectively and constructively.
Demonstrate accountability for work.
Share and seek knowledge and provide feedback to others.
Receptive to others’ ideas and opinions.
Organizational Accountabilities
Organizational Commitment/Identification

Partner in the mission and upholds the core principles of the organization
Committed to diversity and recognizes value of cultural/ ethnic differences
Demonstrate personal and professional integrity
Maintain confidentiality at all times
Customer Service

Anticipate and responds to customer needs; follows up until needs are met
Teamwork/Communication

Demonstrate collaborative and respectful behavior
Partner with all team members to achieve goals
Receptive to others’ ideas and opinions
Performance Improvement/Problem-solving

Contribute to a positive work environment
Demonstrate flexibility and willingness to change
Identify opportunities to improve clinical and administrative processes
Make appropriate decisions, using sound judgment
Cost Management/Financial Responsibility

Use resources efficiently
Search for less costly ways of doing things
Safety

Speak up when team members appear to exhibit unsafe behavior or performance
Continuously validate and verify information needed for decision making or documentation
Stop in the face of uncertainty and takes time to resolve the situation
Demonstrate accurate, clear and timely verbal and written communication
Actively promote safety for patients, families, visitors and co-workers

Position: Director of Software Engineering - Machine Learning & Artificial Intelligence
Description:
Job Description - Director of Software Engineering - Machine Learning & Artificial Intelligence (17007367)Job Description Director of Software Engineering - Machine Learning & Artificial Intelligence - (17007367) Description Grow and direct the scaling
and adoption of Machine Learning across Cigna’s Software Engineering
teams.  We are looking for a talented,
experienced and passionate Machine Learning expert who will grow and direct
Software Engineering teams in the generation of insights that drive customer
behavior by leveraging practices like Recommender Systems, Anomaly detection,
NLP, Machine Vision, Collaborative Filtering, Clustering, Classification,
Regression, Deep Learning, and/or statistical modelling.  

 

Our mission is to help the
people we serve improve their health, well-being and sense of security.

-  End to end hands-on
ownership of machine learning systems deployable across various projects
including data pipelines, model generation, and training and inference
engines. 

-  Quick Proof of Concept (POC) project ownership around projects that need Deep
Learning, Collaborative Filtering, Clustering/Unsupervised learning, mixed with
traditional approaches. POCs should result in rich and deep learning experience
for the organization, so that they can be applied to real world projects that
are also delivered here. 

-  Algorithm development, Model enhancements, around some key research areas
(innovation areas) that SVL is focusing on. This requires constant paper
reading, and staying ahead of the game by knowing what is and will be state of
the art in this exciting field. -  Manage team of Software
Engineers (comprised of a mix of employees and consultants) and grow this team
over time. Qualifications -  Strong background in one or more of:  Deep Learning, Machine Learning,
Natural Language Processing, Computer Vision, Recommendation Systems, Pattern
Recognition, Large Scale Data Mining or Artificial Intelligence. 

-  Strong Experience using one of TensorFlow, MXNet, Theano, Caffe and other
open source frameworks. Solid understanding of underlying concepts of Tensor
Flow (as an example) to understand/enhance the inner workings of an AI
framework of choice 

-  Delivery of a previous AI based project with success and failure stories from
a real customers, with a good sense of lessons learned and a clear interest and
passion in trying out what was learned in new projects
-  Strong hands-on coding expertise with C/C++, Python, Scala, Lua, MATLAB, or any proficient AI language of choice 

-  A mathematical, statistical and probability inclination and deep
understanding of some AI concepts 

-  A sense of ambition and passion to change the world using AI and Deep
Learning-  MS with 6+ years in Computer Science field, or PhD with 3+ years in Computer Science field, or BS with 8+ years of applied machine learning experience.  Degree preferred, not required if candidate possesses equivalent applied machine learning experience and expertiseUS Candidates

Position: Provider Data Analytics - Provider Tax Data Integrity
Description:
Job Description - Provider Data Analytics - Provider Tax Data Integrity (17009402)Job Description Provider Data Analytics - Provider Tax Data Integrity - (17009402) Description Leads mid-sized quality and analytical processes and projects or components of a larger project in a matrix environment involved in the evaluation of requirements and/or the development of new procedures/ processes/or policy solutions to address highly complex Provider Tax data issues.
 
Compiles and analyzes results for identification of improvement opportunities. Provides actionable information and recommendations to management through various analytic techniques on issues related to business people, processes and technology.  
 
Develops, produces, gathers and improves executive and line of business scorecards and decisive and distinct information. Defines and consults on measurement strategies, tools, scorecards and surveys. Provides measurement and cost savings support for data management accuracy. 
 
May work as an individual contributor or lead a team to work on complex analytical processes utilizing judgment, fact, and discretion within a large business organization or across functional areas. 
 
Actions have significant impact on key department objectives.
 
Responsibilities:
- Execute management strategies for Operational Performance & Analyzed Solutions project portfolio, identifying areas of improvement, gathering data, conducting analysis and recommending controls or other actions to ensure accuracy of Provider data for consuming use. 
- Managing multiple complex, time sensitive projects designed to deliver targeted outcomes: 
o Can organize departmental efforts to identify, prioritize and assess the impacts of business process problems and consumption defects
o Can lead efforts to develop data collection plans and data acquisition
o Can lead and train a team in performing analysis activities to deliver to defined objectives 
o Conduct analysis and evaluation of business process and technology through the use of rigorous methods to identify causes of variation, improvement opportunities and solutions considering both upstream inputs into business process and downstream consumers of data 
o Identify opportunities for improvements based on fact based analysis 
o Can summarize results of analysis and effectively communicate to management recommendations for actions to resolve business issues 
- Network Operations & Delivery Balanced Scorecard
o Utilize Network Operations process maps to map data flow through business processes
o Gather and define baseline business metrics primarily to illustrate impact of business outputs to customers
o Utilize trending analysis to identify opportunities in business processes resulting from information in Balanced Scorecard 
- Working in close partnership with business partners is a highly matrix environment 
o Utilize information garnered from analysis to partner with Process Owners and Quality Oversight to identify gaps in business processes. 
o Establish a mentoring program to advance maturity of baseline quality assurance methods to move towards a more outcome based quality program. 
o Partners with departments to develop metrics, analyze problems and recommend improvement opportunities associated with business processes
o Can effectively communicate the results of analysis 
- Coach and develop colleagues 
- Translate business needs into practical applications and solutions
 
  Qualifications - Expert/developer skills in MS Office Suite, including Excel and Access - Expert/developer skills in SAS or SQL Server preferred- Exposure to reporting tools such as Hyperion/Brio, Business Objects, TOAD or COGNOS desired - Elevated exposure to SQL, JavaScript and data warehousing concepts- Advanced degree or at least five years of equivalent experience in related health care analytics - Leadership competencies with the ability to collaborate with others and establish working relationships, communicate effectively across the organization and at different levels, think and act strategically and influence key leader- Strong communication skills – oral, written, and interpersonal skills with the ability to work effectively within diverse groups- Deep healthcare data statistical analysis experience and demonstrated understanding of health care and delivery systems processes - Working knowledge of claim submission, provider selection processes and tax reporting procedures preferred. - Exposure to accounting procedures preferred; ability to reconcile accounts required.   - Exposure to OTIR/PTA preferred.- Ability to take highly complex data relationships and translate to useful action- Ability to solution for the desired outcome- Ability to successfully navigate and contribute in a highly matrix environment - Ability to train and lead a team

Job Description - Senior Data Scientist-Predictive Analytics (17009442)Job Description Senior Data Scientist-Predictive Analytics - (17009442) Description Cigna Information Management & Analytics (CIMA)

The Cigna Information Management & Analytics (CIMA) unit offers solutions that provide actionable insights to internal and external business partners and customers that help reduce health costs, improve outcomes, provide financial security and measure and forecast business performance. The team provides analytical discipline and rigor to enable fact-based decisions for the business.

 
The Senior Data Scientist, Predictive Analytics, will serve as an analyst on a team that supports clinical coaching programs in various areas of the Cigna organization. Utilize data and innovative analytic methods to find valuable data-driven insights. Develop algorithms and statistical models to classify, quantify, predict and/or forecast business metrics. Partner with business units and Analytics colleagues to identify, analyze and maximize success metrics. 
 
Responsibilities:
- Extract and summarize healthcare, demographic and other relevant data 
- Develop analytical and statistical models and methods (including but not limited to regression) that identify and stratify individuals in terms of health risk and/or behavior change
- Uncover historical data trends and apply them to future projections
- Present analytic findings and recommendations to business partners 
- Partner with business units in order to maximize value of clinical outreach programs
- Collaborate with IT partners to deploy efficient, automated solutions that address business and operational needs
- Explore innovative solutions to business questions/problems, including machine learning applications Qualifications 
 
• Master’s degree in mathematical/statistical field (or equivalent experience) • Proactive, creative, innovative and collaborative attitude• Ability to work independently as well as in groups• Experience accessing, manipulating and making sense of large amounts of structured and unstructured data• Ability to manage and prioritize multiple and varied projects simultaneously• Experience with statistical analysis and modeling, including regression, generalized linear models, decision trees• Experience in statistical programming, particularly SAS and/or R• Familiarity with database and data store languages and tools, such as: SQL, Oracle, Teradata, Hadoop• Strong communication, presentation and storytelling skills• Ability to consult with business stakeholders to solve their business problems• Some Experience in advanced predictive methods such as: linear regression, logistic regression, neural network, decision trees and Markov Change, Random Forests & Time Series models and general estimation equations (GEE) and structural equation modeling

Job Description - Healthcare Data Science Manager-Group Insurance (17009298)Job Description Healthcare Data Science Manager-Group Insurance - (17009298) Description Cigna Information Management & Analytics (CIMA)

The Cigna Information Management & Analytics (CIMA) unit offers solutions that provide actionable insights to internal and external business partners and customers that help reduce health costs, improve outcomes, provide financial security and measure and forecast business performance. The Information Management & Analytics team has joint accountability with business operations to achieve Cigna’s customer-centric, business growth objectives and strives for high levels of alignment, day-to-day engagement and. The team provides analytical discipline and rigor to enable fact-based decisions for the business.

Role Summary:

This person will be leading development of comprehensive analytics and resources to help understand the performance of and identify improvement opportunities in Cigna's Solution across Group, Voluntary, Dental, Vision and Stop Loss.

Responsibilities:

1. Lead and Manage: build a new data science team to focus on Group, Voluntary, Dental, Vision and Stop Loss. Utilize data science and advanced analytics to create actionable insights and recommendations for business leaders to advance Cigna strategic objectives. 
2. Solution performance: analytics to understand the performance of Cigna's solutions as well as the integrated value of solutions across medical or pharmacy for example.  
3. Driver and opportunity analysis: analytics to identify the drivers of affordability and/or quality improvement (specific interventions or actions) and to identify opportunities to enhance affordability or quality outcomes.  
4. Test & Learn Pilots: collaborate with business leaders to design, launch and measure robust pilots to test new solution ideas or customer interventions. 

 

Key Skillsets:
1. Subject matter expertise in group disability, life and accident products
2. Subject matter expertise in voluntary life, accident and critical illness products
3. Working knowledge of stop loss, dental or vision preferred. 
4. Statistical training in school or through work (ability to formulate and execute appropriate confidence intervals, power analysis, bootstrapping, regression modeling, etc.)
5. Strong technical skills to extract large amount of data through SAS/Teradata/Hadoop/Oracle and construct easy to use tools and reports using VBA/Tableau/R/Python/GIS tools. Qualifications This position requires previous experience with group/voluntary insurance and healthcare content knowledge, analytic & information management expertise.

· Strong customer focus and track record of satisfied matrix partners 
· Advanced degree or equivalent experience in Statistics, Biostatistics, Econometrics, Economics, Actuarial Science, or Data Science 
· Minimum 5 years’ work experience in healthcare analytics/data science
· Consultative leadership competencies with the ability to collaborate with others and establish working relationships, communicate effectively across the organization and at different levels, think and act strategically, and influence key leaders 
· To influence, drive, and improve the areas above, the person in this position will need to be self-motivated and possess strong leadership qualities. 
· Knowledge of healthcare data (e.g., claims, eligibility, groupers, profiling, EMR), statistical analysis aptitude, and demonstrated understanding of health care and delivery system processes 
· Ability to successfully navigate and contribute in a highly-matrixed environment

Technical Lead
Qualification:Bachelors in science , engineering or equivalent
Responsibility:
Project Planning and Setup:• Understand the project scope, identify activities/ tasks, task level estimates, schedule, dependencies, risks and provide inputs to Module Lead for review.• Provide inputs to testing strategy, configuration, deployment, hardware/software requirement etc.• Review plan and provide feedback on gaps, timeline and execution feasibility etc as required in the project.• Participate in KT sessions conducted by customer/ other business teams and provide feedback on requirements.
Requirement Understanding and Analysis:• Analyze functional/non functional requirements and seek clarifications for better understanding of requirements.• Based on understanding of system upstream & downstream, provide feedback and inputs on gaps in requirements and technical feasibility of requirements.
Design:• Prepare the LLD/ detailed design documents based on HLD and briefing from Module Lead.• Seek inputs from the developers on specific modules as applicable.• Consolidate all modules and provide to Module Lead/ Architects/ Designers for review.• Suggest changes in design on technical grounds.• Develop components inventory for the code to be developed tying it to the nonfunctional requirements.• Perform sampling of data to understand the character/ quality of the data (project dependent in the absence of data analyst or designer).• Identify tools and technologies to be used in the project as well as reusable objects that could be customized for the project.
Coding:• Follow coding standards and best practices to develop code and check code quality.• Share developed code with supervisor for review.• Rework on the code based on inputs if required.• Perform complex integration.• Guide the developers in identifying, preparing and conducting unit test cases and fixing defects based on results.• Consolidate the test results and share with supervisor.• Provide periodic status update to supervisor and highlight / recommend any changes in design based on challenges faced.• Anticipate unreported defects and raise the same to supervisor.• Conduct technical troubleshooting.• Conduct reviews for codes created by team.
Testing Management:• Develop unit test case for each module.• Conduct/ guide conducting of unit and integration testing and fix defects.• Review/ approve code to be moved to testing environment.• Provide support to the QA team and coordinate for various phases of testing.• Address queries raised by QA within defined timelines.• Investigate critical defects and establish need for fixing.• Raise issues to leads/QA.• Report defect status as per project standard process within agreed timelines.• Share revised code with supervisor for review.• Assist team lead and project manager on estimates around defect fixes.
Configuration Management:• Maintain versions of the code or consolidate version maintained by the Developers.• Provide support as required to the Administrators during configuration, code backups, deployment etc.
Deployment:• Assess and create deployment/ roll back plan.• Validate if all the components have been migrated and the right version is checked in.• Maintain deployment tracker.• Perform sanity checks post deployment to ensure smooth production.• Share activity status with supervisor and highlight concerns if any.
Project Execution Monitoring & closure (Support to Project Management activities):• Monitor work of the developers and share work achieved with them.• Provide guidance through SDLC.• Provide status of progress to leads.• In case of change requests, provide inputs on the plan.
Service Support and Maintenance:
Specific to production and maintenance support:• Provide support for 1 week and hand over to production team.• Identify if the incoming request is a service request/ defect during the warranty or an incident.• If it is code defect in the warranty, highlight to Lead and initiate defect fix process.• Post warranty, support in transition to maintenance team.
Knowledge Management:• Post release participate in project review call and discuss points on what went well and what didn't.• Create and update knowledge articles (case studies, lessons learnt) in the knowledge management repository.• Guide developers in creating such documents.• Publish white papers/ blogs/ articles (if required).
People Management:• Conduct training through academy or internally within the team.• Conduct technical, face to face interviews for internal transfer or external hiring.• Provide feedback on Developers form technical /domain standpoint to the module lead. Cognizant US Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer Minority/Female/Disability/Veteran. Job Description - Buiness Associate-ETL (00024011081)Job Description Buiness Associate-ETL(Job Number: 00024011081) Description 
Module lead(Depends on the project)
Qualification:Bachelors in science , engineering or equivalent
Responsibility:
Requirement Understanding and Analysis:• Review the raw requirements to understand the key outcomes expected by the client.• Identify data source and conduct data profiling to understand data and its quality.• Create a logic that needs to be incorporated in the architecture to ensure the data meets the requirements.• Create POC to conduct the feasibility of the requirement, as required.
Data Discovery & Profiling:• Post signoff, design basic queries to analyze the existing data.• Share sample data with the client to give a snapshot of the expected outcome.• Create a low level design document capturing SQL queries to achieve the target stage.• Share the document with the ETL team.• Conduct system integration testing during data migration from the source to the target state to ensure the requirements are met.• Conduct the root cause analysis of the issue to identify the solutions to resolve it.• Conduct testing to ensure the issue has been resolved.• In case of data issues, report it to the source team to fix the data.• If data is corrupted during migration, identify ways to cleanup the data.• Generate reports to fix the issues as required.• Understand the impact on data based on the release schedule.• Based on the understanding of the legacy system, provide inputs to the data modeler to map the attributes to the fields.• Share the data mapping documents with the data modeling team.• Support data modeling team to understand the data / data type in the legacy system.• Support data modeling team in defining table name and table data type as per the standards and best practices defined within the project.• In case of any new table in Data Warehouse, identify the source values to be uploaded in the table.• Provide inputs to data modeling regarding the source data for the same.
Knowledge Management:• Create and update knowledge articles (industry Point of View, Case studies, lessons learnt document etc) in the knowledge management repository.• Maintain knowledge management database.• Conduct training for team members on data profiling tools and techniques.
Sales Support:• Based on the inputs shared by the stakeholders.• share the inputs on RFPs on the data profiling and system analysis aspect.• Evaluate/ identify the tools best fit for the customer requirement. Cognizant US Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer Minority/Female/Disability/Veteran. Job Description - Data Analyst - Remediation (00023322813)Job Description Data Analyst - Remediation(Job Number: 00023322813) Description Data Analyst 

 

Responsibilities
Include:

        Assisting
with gathering and reviewing the business rules during the implementation
process of new clients for claims that require submission of the encounter data
for compliance with government programs, such as Medicare and Medicaid.

Understand
     the impact of system primarily used/maintained.Candidate
     must be familiar with SQL, able to communicate reporting requests to
     Analytics team, review results, conduct root cause analysis, identify next
     steps and put them into action.Maintaining
     and adhering to standardized processes through the use of Desk Level
     procedures, reports, response files and various external resources in
     order to route issues for timely resolution to allow for program
     compliance on behalf of the clients.Analyzing
     data in both the claim source and EDM databases to find root cause for
     encounters still outstanding, identifying various trends in data or
     processing issues, and routing to the appropriate team for resolution. Understand
     and be able to communicate noted system and/or code issues with systems
     and development teams. Providing
     information for documentation detailing the procedures, outcomes, and
     observations and making recommendations for updates and changes to the
     Health Plan and/or members of the BMS Claims team in order for the data to
     meet regulatory compliance for programs such as Medicare and Medicaid.Creating
     and following through on work tickets created to correct data elements on
     claims, member and provider records. Collaborating
     and working closely with the client and other BMS teams to promote
     effective working relationships and monitoring response time of error
     resolution

 

Qualifications Include:

Bachelor's Degree in Healthcare, Healthcare Management, Information
Technology, Business, or a related discipline required. An equivalent
combination of education and work experience may be taken into consideration in
lieu of a degree.Minimum of 5 years of related experience in healthcare/insurance,
ideally in Medicaid and/or Medicare.  Including
high level understanding of the functions of all various departments.  Exposure to claims adjudication and
adjustment, membership, provider maintenance, code sets, and professional &
institutional claims is necessary. Experience with Claims systems is mandatory, experience with
EDM or other backend encounters processing system preferred.Knowledge of Medicaid and/or Medicare requirementsKnowledge of X12 file format, 835, and 837 preferred.Intermediate-Advanced experience using Access and Excel
(pivot tables, look-ups, sorting, maneuvering, advanced formulas)  is requiredAbility to manage competing deadlines.Strong communication skills, in both technical and
healthcare

and technical feasibility of requirements.Design:• Prepare the LLD/ detailed design documents based on HLD and briefing from Module Lead.• Seek inputs from the developers on specific modules as applicable.• Consolidate all modules and provide to Module Lead/ Architects/ Designers for review.• Suggest changes in design on technical grounds.• Develop components inventory for the code to be developed tying it to the nonfunctional requirements.• Perform sampling of data to understand the character/ quality of the data (project dependent in the absence of data analyst or designer).• check code quality.• Share developed code with supervisor for review.• Rework on the code based on inputs if required.• Perform complex integration.• Guide the developers in identifying, preparing and conducting unit test cases and fixing defects based on results.• Consolidate the test results and share with supervisor.• Provide periodic status update to supervisor and highlight / recommend any changes in design based on challenges faced.• Anticipate unreported defects and raise the same to supervisor.• Conduct technical troubleshooting.• Conduct reviews for codes created by team.Testing Management:• Develop unit test case for each module.• Conduct/ guide conducting of unit and integration testing and fix defects.• Review/ approve code to be moved to testing environment.• Provide support to the QA team and coordinate for various phases of testing.• Address queries raised by QA within defined timelines.• Investigate critical defects and establish need for fixing.• Raise issues to leads/QA.• Report defect status as per project standard process within agreed timelines.• Share revised code with supervisor for review.• Assist team lead and project manager on estimates around defect fixes.Configuration Management:• Maintain versions of the code or consolidate version maintained by the Developers.• Provide support as required to the Administrators during configuration, code backups, deployment etc.Deployment:• Assess and create deployment/ roll back plan.• Validate if all the components have been migrated and the right version is checked in.• Maintain deployment tracker.• Perform sanity checks post deployment to ensure smooth production.• Share activity status with supervisor and highlight concerns if any.Project Execution Monitoring & closure (Support to Project Management activities):• Monitor work of the developers and share work achieved with them.• Provide guidance through SDLC.• Provide status of progress to leads.• In case of change requests, provide inputs on the plan.Service Support and Maintenance:Specific to production and maintenance support:• Provide support for 1 week and hand over to production team.• Identify if the incoming request is a service request/ defect during the warranty or an incident.• If it is code defect in the warranty, highlight to Lead and initiate defect fix process.• Post warranty, support in transition to maintenance team.Knowledge Management:• Post release participate in project review call and discuss points on what went well and what didn't.• Create and update knowledge articles (case studies, lessons learnt) in the knowledge management repository.• Guide developers in creating such documents.• Publish white papers/ blogs/ articles (if required).People Management:• Conduct training through academy or internally within the team.• Conduct technical, face to face interviews for internal transfer or external hiring.• Provide feedback on Developers form technical /domain standpoint to the module lead. Cognizant US Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer Minority/Female/Disability/Veteran. Description:
Job Description - Sr. Developer – Oracle PL/SQL (CNX00045746)Job Description Sr. Developer – Oracle PL/SQL - (CNX00045746)Description Under general direction, participates as a high level technical expert in design, development, coding, testing, and debugging of new software or significant enhancements to existing software.  Works with technical staff to understand problems with software and develops specifications to resolve them.  Competent to work at the highest technical level of all phases of applications programming activities.           
 
SPECIFIC RESPONSIBILITIES

Design and Develop Oracle PL/SQL packages, procedures and functions.
Creation and monitoring of batch jobs utilizing a job scheduler.
May design and implement web applications.
Interface with customer to obtain a full understanding of the project requirements in order to recommend the appropriate technology to accomplish requirements.
Provide project timeline estimates.
Monitor actual deliverable deadlines against scheduled completion dates.
Participate in all phases of Software Development Lifecycle.
Support both client and department programming standards.
Perform unit testing of all applications developed and/or enhancements to systems.
Work with Quality Assurance team to ensure quality of work produced.
Take ownership of assigned accounts.
Monitor application efficiencies to identify means of enhancing performance.
Ability to be self-directed, able to focus on personal assignments while remaining part of a larger team with proven ability to multi-task.
Willingness to learn, adapt new technologies 
 
 
ESSENTIAL QUALIFICATIONS
Education/Knowledge:      
 
Bachelor’s Degree from a four-year University or College diploma in related field preferred.  Equivalent experience and/or technical training may be considered.
 
Experience / Skill:         

6+ years of current PL/SQL experience. 
2+ years of current Java experience.
2+ years of UNIX/ LINUX shell scripting.
Possess technical background and experience supporting Oracle applications, tools and databases.
Strong experience with Oracle Object Design and implementation (Oracle Packages, Procedures, Triggers).
Experience writing UNIX scripts.
Working knowledge of source code management tool and job scheduler.
Strong business analysis skills with proven experience in proposing and developing solutions.
Strong systems analysis experience.
Comfortable with maintenance of existing code base as well as new development.
Well organized with proven success in managing assignments (supporting end users) to timely completion.
            
Experience with any of the following would be considered beneficial:

ColdFusion experience in creating web applications with connectivity to Oracle databases.
Experience with Appworx, Adobe Flex, SQL Server, .Net, SQL and/or Microsoft DTS.
Experience working in a client focused environment.
 
REPORTING STRUCTURE
The Senior Developer reports to the Development Manager.
 
COMPETENCIES
 
Adaptability – Is able and willing to adapt to changing priorities and responsibilities.  Able to adjust personal style to changing environment.  Maintains focus and intensity and remains calm, optimistic and persistent, even under adversity.
 
Communication (Verbal and/or Written) - Able to clearly present information through the spoken and/or written word, influence or persuade others through oral presentation in positive or negative circumstances, listens well, able to write clearly in a variety of communication settings and styles.
 
Organization and Planning - Anticipates needs, determines priorities and establishes the appropriate courses of action, set goals.  Monitors performance towards goals and makes adjustments, as necessary, to facilitate goal attainment.  Able to organize/schedule people or tasks, develops actions plans while being sensitive to time constraints and resources availability.
 
Job Knowledge - Knows, understands and appropriately applies the technical /soft skills, methods and processes required for the position. Is able to learn, retain and apply information to the job. Keeps current with new and/or updated program information, trends and developments in field.
 
Perseverance - Pursues everything with energy, drive, and a need to finish; seldom gives up before finishing, especially in the face of resistance or setbacks.
 
Problem Solving - Systematically breaks apart complex problems and identifies the underlying causes.  Identifies trends and sees causes and consequences.  Generates a variety of alternative techniques or methods to resolve issues and/or solve problems.
 
Quality Orientation - The ability to complete work accurately and thoroughly, paying attention to the details of job responsibilities.  Produces a minimum amount of errors while completing work.  Able to recognize errors in work in progress and make necessary real time corrections. Accurately checks processes and tasks and monitors the results of delegated tasks, assignments and projects.
 
Teamwork - The ability to work effectively with others to generate a positive, productive and informed work environment.  Is united in the collective purpose.

Job Description - Data Analyst/MD Assist-HIM - Full Time Days (7470-1795)Job Description Data Analyst/MD Assist-HIM - Full Time Days-7470-1795 Clark MemorialDescription 



High School Diploma or GED with Health Information Management or Health Care experience required.  Able to perform multiple tasks with frequent interruptions, maintain patient confidentiality of records and utilize hospital mainframe computer system to perform day - to - day operations. Responsible for analysis of the medical record to ensure the integrity of the electronic medical record. Serves as the primary contact person and trainer of the physicians in the completion of the EMR (deficiencies and use). Maintains integrity of chart completion systems and carries out the suspension notification process and suspension policy. Must be able to understand and learn new tasks and problem solve to assure positive outcome for our customers.Will cross-train to perform duties of ROI, Indexer and Prepper/ScannerQualifications Excellent communication skills required.Job Health Information Management/CodingPrimary Location Indiana-Jeffersonville Schedule Full-timeShift Day Job

Job Description - Quality Data Analyst 7459-1100 (7459-1100)Job Description Quality Data Analyst 7459-1100-7459-1100 Description 
An exciting opportunity for a Quality Data Analyst is now available at UPHS-Portage. In this position, you will collect, organize, analyze, monitor and facilitate improvement in the overall quality of care provided. This position serves as an analytical resource to the quality team and medical staff on quality initiatives with reporting , performance improvement and efficiency measures, provides guidance and support, and assists with education and training related to leading practice.Qualifications 
Associate’s Degree required
Bachelor’s Degree preferred
Clinical license in State of Michigan
Knowledge of abstracting medical records, core measures and medical staff peer review preferred
 

 Job QualityPrimary Location Michigan-Hancock Schedule Full-timeShift Day Job

At DHL, people mean the world to us. That’s why our goal has always been to attract and retain the best talent across the globe. We provide challenge and opportunity for personal and professional development. We recognize the difference you bring to our business and together we share the pride of building one of the world’s largest leaders in logistics and supply chain solutions. Our purpose as the Logistics Company for the World is to connect people, improving their lives. We focus on our customers’ needs. We don’t just deliver parcels and packages - We also deliver prosperity, we transport health, we power growth and we deliver joy.SummaryDHL is hiring a part-time Data Analyst to assist our Corporate Real Estate (CRE) team in Plantation, Florida.  If you are high energy, analytical, an Excel ninja, and fluent (reading, writing and speaking) in Spanish we want to meet you.  In this 3 month assignment, you’ll enter, interpret and analyze data; ensure quality of the collected data; maintain the CoStar database, and monitor responses from our LATAM properties.  Additional responsibilities and qualifications include:Qualifications: ·Bilingual English and Spanish.  Strong communication in both languages (required)·Strong knowledge of Excel and databases: vlookups and pivot tables (required)·Proven experience working as a data analyst (required)·Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy (required)·Lease administration skills (preferred)Key Responsibilities: ·Request data·Interpret data·Analyze data·Enter in the CRE database·Generate reports to reflect portfolio activity·Acquire data from various sources including Lease Coordinators, email, CoStar database·Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets·Filter and clean data by reviewing computer reports and printouts·Work with team to prioritize information needs·Share any new process improvement opportunitiesDPDHL is an equal opportunity employer.  We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other protected characteristics.​  If you would like to be considered for this elite organization, please submit your resume and cover letter online.

Position: Forensic Data Analytics Assistant Director (Remediation)  - London
Description:
Job Description - Forensic Data Analytics Assistant Director (Remediation)  - London (LON00BMQ)Job Description Forensic Data Analytics Assistant Director (Remediation)  - London - LON00BMQGB-England-LondonForensic Data Analytics Assistant Director, London
 
EY’s Forensic Technology & Discovery Services (FTDS) team forms part of the Fraud Investigation & Dispute Services (FIDS) business unit and specialises in forensic technology services encompassing eDiscovery, Forensic Data Analytics and IT Forensic investigations. Using state of the art tools, our teams support clients with compliance management, fraud investigation and fraud detection. 
 
The Forensic Data Analytics team are a global group of technical specialists that practice the full life cycle of data management from the early stages of data scoping and capture, to its management, analysis and reporting. The nature of our work typically requires working with large datasets from disparate data sources to support fraud investigations and disputes for our clients covering a range of industries. This is achieved by combining deep forensic investigation knowledge with advanced data analytics techniques such as investigative data linking, social network analysis, statistics, artificial intelligence, machine learning and predictive modelling.
 
Our Forensic Technology & Discovery Services (FTDS) lab provides cutting edge forensic technology infrastructure and tools necessary to uncover the most complex frauds close to the occurrence.
 
What you will do:
 

Develop business development initiatives, creating demand, converting sales, engagement delivery and knowledge management, previous proven experience of achieving sales targets greater than £1m
Managing multi-disciplinary teams, client and 3rd party professionals on client engagements and providing leadership and shape delivery approaches
Acting as a subject matter expert in advising clients to gain greater insight into their data and the value that data analytics can bring to an organisation. 
Take a significant role in the growth of the team and wider practice, sharing knowledge and supporting the development of other team members.
Work to support clients and fraud examiners on the benefits of forensic data analysis and how it can be applied to their issues
Requirements:

Strong academic background with a degree level qualification in a relevant discipline.
Experience of advising external clients on insights and strategies related to data analytics, ideally in the fraud domain.
Experience of leading large teams, complex engagements and mentoring and coaching junior staff to maximise performance.
Competence in using database management software, statistical and predictive machine learning software and link analysis / data visualization software.
Technically competent in the following areas: data collection and load, data quality assessment, data cleansing, complex data transformation, relationship profiling, sampling and extrapolation, segmentation, statistical modelling, segmentation, structured data mining, text mining and analytical matching
Strong knowledge of SQL and relational database
Data remediation - proactive, data-driven, outbound redress. Familiarity with building and operationalising automated case processing platforms to remediate large customer populations in retail banking. Ideally with Mortgage and Unsecured Lending experience
Choice of processing platform likely to be based on the Relativity review platform to leverage existing case reporting and audit requirements – underlying technology stack MS SQL  Who we are
 

EY is committed to being an inclusive employer and we are happy to consider flexible working arrangements. We strive to achieve the right balance for our people, enabling us to deliver excellent client service whilst allowing you to build your career without sacrificing your personal priorities. While our client-facing professionals can be required to travel regularly, and at times be based at client sites, our flexible working arrangements can help you to achieve a lifestyle balance.

EY is a global leader in assurance, tax, transaction and advisory services. The insights and quality services we deliver help build trust and confidence in the capital markets and in economies the world over. In so doing, we play a critical role in building a better working world for our people, for our clients and for our communities. Visit us at http://www.ey.com/CH/en/Careers
 
The rapidly growing Digital Competence and Innovation Center is currently seeking the right candidate for an excellent career opportunity in the Data Scientist team. 
 
The team is a global group of technical consultants that runs the full life cycle of data management from the early stages of data scoping and capture, to its management, analysis and reporting. The nature of our work typically requires working with large datasets from disparate data sources to support process analytics and mining, fraud investigations and disputes for our clients covering a range of industries. This is achieved by combining deep business process knowledge with analytics techniques such as investigative data linking, social network analysis, statistics, artificial intelligence, machine learning and predictive modelling.

Experience in utilizing and deploying ETL software (e.g. SSIS, CloverETL, Talend, SAP Data Services)
Excellent relational SQL database skills (Open SQL, PL-SQL or T-SQL)
Demonstrate understanding in at least one programming language such as R, Python, Java, C++ or C#
Experience using data visualization tools such as Tableau, Qlik, Spotfire

Data analysis skills with strengths in drilling into underlying databases for discovery and identifying opportunities and trends and translating these into understandable and meaningful business outputs

4-6 years of work experience in a similar field

Enterprise Intelligence
 
Our clients are faced with external pressures on an unprecedented scale. The ability to translate strategy into reality is key to their enhanced business performance. As an advisory professional, you will be focused on helping them achieve this goal.
 
You’ll work in high-performing teams that deliver exceptional client service, enabling organizations to grow, innovate, protect and optimize their business performance – playing your part in building a better working world.
