Position: Manager, Data Analysis DBMI – SE AETC - (Term Position)
Description:
Job Description - Manager, Data Analysis DBMI – SE AETC - (Term Position) (1710136)Job Description 1710136- Manager, Data Analysis DBMI – SE AETC - (Term Position)Job: Administrative and Clerical SupportPrimary Location: TN-Nashville-Vanderbilt Hospital (VUH)Organization: Health Policy 104625Description Manager, Data Analysis DBMI – SE AETC Details to add to top of Job Description
The Manager, Data Analysis DBMI for the Southeast AIDS Education and Training Center (SE AETC) at the Vanderbilt Comprehensive Care Clinic will work with the AETC Team and our partners to ensure that data are collected, reported, analyzed and evaluated to inform our work and measure our performance and impact. The Data Analysis Manager is responsible for evaluation and for providing support for complex, qualitative and quantitative projects related to educating the HIV workforce. Ideal candidates will have experience in evaluation, epidemiology, public health, or related disciplines. Duties will include the following:

Evaluate programs and projects of the Southeast AETC including live events; online training; preceptorships; technical assistance; and Minority AIDS Initiative, Practice Transformation, and Interprofessional Education activities. Coordinate literature searches, data collection and analysis, and special projects. Represent the SE AETC on national evaluation calls; collaborate with evaluation partners and subcontracts. Research and develop evaluation tools as needed.
·         Communicate with state partners about their training data to ensure that all required records and evaluations have been entered into the database system. Train partners on proper data collection and reporting.
·         Prepare ongoing and ad hoc data reports from the Tennessee and SE AETC databases. Prepare reports and requests for data from Webcast Wednesday, CDC data, monthly reports to partners; reports to HRSA (funder).
·         Participate in evaluation work group, epi outcomes group, VCCC CQI committee, strategic learning innovation team meetings, weekly staff meetings, and other meetings as required.
·         Work with the media specialist to prepare charts, graphs, and tables for SE AETC newsletter and other marketing posters and projects.
·         Assess SE AETC program and evaluation data to determine points of publication.
·         Experience with REDCap, R and mapping programs a plus.
 
 
Preferred qualifications – Master’s Degree 
*CABasic Qualifications Bachelor's Degree and 5 years relevant experience Licensure, Certification, and/or Registration (LCR):
Physical Requirements/Strengths needed & Physical Demands:

Sedentary category requiring exertion up to 10 lbs. of force occasionally and uses negligible amounts of force to move objects. Sedentary work involves sitting most of the time.Movement

Occasional: Standing: Remaining on one's feet without moving.
Occasional: Walking: Moving about on foot.
Occasional: Lifting under 35 lbs: Raising and lowering objects under 35 lbs from one level to another
Occasional: Carrying under 35 lbs: Transporting an object holding in hands, arms or shoulders, with help of coworkers or assistive device.
Occasional: Bending/Stooping: Trunk bending downward and forward by bending spine at waist requiring full use of lower extremities and back muscles
Occasional: Balancing: Maintaining body equilibrium to prevent falling when walking, standing, crouching or maneuvering self, patient and equipment simultaneously while working in large and small spaces
Occasional: Reaching above shoulders: Extending arms in any direction above shoulders.
Frequent: Sitting: Remaining in seated position
Frequent: Reaching below shoulders: Extending arms in any direction below shoulders.
Frequent: Fingering: Picking, pinching, gripping, working primarily with fingers requiring fine manipulation.
Frequent: Bimanual Dexterity: Requiring the use of both hands.Sensory

Continuous: Communication: Expressing or exchanging written/verbal/electronic information.
Continuous: Auditory: Perceiving the variances of sounds, tones and pitches and able to focus on single source of auditory information
Continuous: Vision: Clarity of near vision at 20 inches or less and far vision at 20 feet or more with depth perception, peripheral vision, color vision.
Continuous: Smell: Ability to detect and identify odors.Environmental Conditions

Job DescriptionWe are looking for a database developer to join the team supporting the Credit Risk data and Regulatory reporting platform (WCDIR). To be successful in this role, you will need an extensive background in Teradata or similar technology, building complex data systems, and a good understanding of commercial loan or non-loan domain. You will be working closely with business and technology partners to build and support the platform.This role will involve:* Working as a developer implementing technical solutions working with technical leadership and business partners of Wholesale Credit Risk and Exposure reporting datamart.* Performs and supports production jobs and processes* Works closely with business team to analyze requirements, design code and develop technical solution. Performs complex ETL coding, database programming using Teradata or similar technology stacks* Performs build, test and deploy* Develops new documentation and technical procedures.* Assures quality, security and compliance requirements are met and supported * Ability to research and identify root cause of complex production issues. * Prepare detailed specifications and ETL design documentation. * Ability to effectively communicate concepts and solutions. In addition, will have production support responsibilities of the data processing applications. Collaborate with Enterprise Availability Office (EACO), Wholesale Service Level Management, System Admins, Middleware Support, DBAs, Developers and other stakeholders relevant to addressing production issues.Required Qualifications5+ years of application development and implementation experience5+ years of data warehouse experience5+ years of ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) Programming experience5+ years of experience with databases such as Oracle, DB2, SQL server, or Teradata4+ years of stored procedures development experience3+ years of performance tuning experience2 + years of experience gathering business requirements from various sources including end-users and stakeholders3+ years of application production support experienceDesired QualificationsExcellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skillsA BS/BA degree or higher in information technologyHadoop experienceAbility to work effectively in virtual environment where key team members and partners are in various time zones and locationsKnowledge and understanding of outsourcing vendors and in-house software development teams focused on data solutionsKnowledge and understanding of technology support: System including business requirement design or review, release management support, test script development and execution, and system issue resolutionExperience successfully escalating complex issues and tracking follow-through to completionJob ExpectationsWillingness to work on-site at stated location on the job openingDisclaimerAll offers for employment with Wells Fargo are contingent upon the candidate having successfully completed a criminal background check.  Wells Fargo will consider qualified candidates with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable local, state and Federal law, including Section 19 of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act.Relevant military experience is considered for veterans and transitioning service men and women.Wells Fargo is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer, Minority/Female/Disabled/Veteran/Gender Identity/Sexual Orientation.

Description:
WorldStrides is the largest and most trusted educational student travel company in the country, providing a variety of educational travel programs to more than two million elementary, middle, high school, college, and graduate students since its inception in 1967. For converted Full time employees WorldStrides offers excellent benefits including travel discounts, 401K, health, dental, ACAC Health & Wellness Center membership subsidies, as well as a great working environment and growth opportunities. This position is located in our headquarters office in Charlottesville, VA, recently voted "the best place to live" based on quality of life.
Responsibilities:
 
A successful candidate should be able to perform, but not be limited to, the following duties:
Work independently on development projects with minimal supervision and assistance.
Mentor and guide other team developers on projects and programming techniques.
Analyze and design object-oriented data models.
Provide analysis, problem identification and support for a variety of C# applications.
Positively interact with users in regards to projects or helpdesk issues.
Maintain good practices for both in-program and external documentation.
Demonstrate ability to learn new applications by quickly developing a high level of functional expertise in relation to our business and applications.
Communicate effectively and positively with programmers, project managers and supervisors.
Required Skills and Abilities:
4+ years of experience with C# and .NET development.
Experience developing or consuming Web Services in the .Net environment
Experience with working with SQL Server (2008 and above)
Experience in object oriented design methodology
Ability to visually review specifications documents and provide input on successfully implementing business solutions
Ability to work independently or with a team and lead a project to completion
Above-average oral, written, and interpersonal communications skills
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science. (Combinations of college-level course work in IT/Programming and relevant experience can substitute for a four year degree.)
Desired Skills and Abilities:
Experience ASP.NET, JavaScript, and jQuery development
Experience with TIBCO ActiveMatrix messaging server or other enterprise service bus (ESB) solutions.
Experience with NetSuite or financial system integrations
Experience with MS Dynamics CRM or CRM system integrations
Experience with SCRUM methodology
